# name

**Instance Property**

A name associated with the light.

## Declaration

```swift
var name: String? { get set }
```

## Discussion

You can provide a descriptive name for a light to make managing your scene graph easier. Lights loaded from a scene file may have names assigned by an artist using a 3D authoring tool. To examine lights in a scene file without loading its scene graph, use the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSceneSource] class.

Light names are saved when you export a scene to a file using its [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNScene/write(to:options:delegate:progressHandler:)] method. Light names also appear in the Xcode scene editor.

## Managing Light Attributes

- **attribute(forKey:)**: Returns the value of a lighting attribute.
- **setAttribute(_:forKey:)**: Sets the value for a lighting attribute.
- **Lighting Attribute Keys**: Keys for specifying the behavior of a light using the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/attribute(forKey:)] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/setAttribute(_:forKey:)] methods.
